document.docAuthor: Jaeger, Bernd, M, Boris & W, David
document.masterDocTitle: New synonyms, and first and interesting records of certain species of the subtribe Stenolophina from the Palaearctic, Oriental and Afrotropical regions (Coleoptera, Carabidae, Harpalini, Stenolophina)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New synonyms, and first and interesting records of certain species of the subtribe Stenolophina from the Palaearctic, Oriental and Afrotropical regions (Coleoptera, Carabidae, Harpalini, Stenolophina)

The species is widely distributed in eastern Asia and has been recorded for Japan , the Russian Far East, South Korea and the Chinese provinces of Chonquing, Gansu , Qinghai , Shaanxi , Zhejiang and Sichuan ( JAEGER 1993: 941 , JAEGER 1995: 1072 , JAEGER & KATAEV 2003: 402 , PAIK & JUNG 2004: 33). Here additional records from China (including first records for Beijing , Heilongjiang , Hubei , Xizang , and Yunnan ) and South Korea are provided.

M a t e r i a l e x a m i n e d C h i n a

;
W of Lugu Lake , 27°41'26"N / 100°35'18"E , H=
3750 m
,
31.V.2012
, I. Belousov , G. Davidian , I. Kabak & A. Korolev (16 - cIB& IK )
.
Described from the Yulong Shan in the Chinese province of Yunnan , the species was hitherto only known from the types . Here additional records for Yunnan are provided.
